Just a fact: Lucian used to be played as an AD caster before the nerfs from 4.19. Players were trying to max cooldown reduction on him (with Ionian Boots, Youmuu's, masteries and runes) and focus on his passive and his AD ratios, instead of playing him with attack speed like most ADCs. 

This build is still viable but it is not nearly as strong as before, that's why most people play him like a normal ADC. Statikk Shiv has a lot of synergy with his passive, too.

I feel like you're exaggarating a little bit. Sure, Kalista can be annoying as all hell to fight, but she's not the most OP thing out there. Also, the way you describe things make them sound a lot better than they actually are.

1. Considerable amount of damage with W Passive. Yes, it IS a considerable amount, that's true. But it can only happen once every 6 seconds, not to mention it needs the support to be hitting the same target. She can't do it alone.

2. Infinite scaling damage. First of all; that's actually false. It DOES stop. Second; saying "Infinite Scaling Damage" implies someting like Veigar or Nasus' Q. Rend does a LOT of damage, that's true, but she still has to stack it up a while for that to actually happen, and if no one is protecting her, it shouldn't be TOO difficult to kill her before her stacks get out of hand.

3. "INFINITE mobility" I don't think you quite grasp how much the word "Infinite" actually implies. Here's the thing; Kalista can't jump INFINITELY. Not unless there's enemies nearby. Her jumps are also pretty short range. She ain't exactly LeBlanc. It's good for manouvering the battlefield, not a huge amount else.

Not saying Riot didn't mess up a bit with Kalista, but hey, they've at least TRIED to fix her. Her hops are far from as good as they used to be. Honestly though, I think Kalista would be WAY worse if they didn't focus on teamwork with her support as the biggest part of her kit. Imagine if she could do all this shit completely on her own.

If she has no enemies to AA, she has no reason at all to dash.
Also, her Q makes her dash

10 health left, being chased by Caitlyn up river, near the dragon pit. Enemy jungler is trying to pincer her, so she can't reach the opening. She's gonna want to cross that wall. If she Qs, Cait can simply follow her and E. If she tries to use a basic attack; SURPRISE! Cait kills her(Really though, any ADC with 550 range can do that.) It's a situational example, sure, but it's there nonetheless. 

Point is; Kalista's jump is only for positioning while *in battle,* and can't be used for much else. You can dodge skillshots with it, sure, but so can any other ADC by simply *walking out of the way.* There ARE some disadvantages to Kalista's jumps too. It's easy for beginner Kalista players to accidentally jump out of range, and even when you get a bit better at her that can happen sometimes. It's not *precise,* so there's a thing you can abuse against her. Another thing you can do is force her to constantly jump, that's actually going to lower her DPS that alone. While she's jumping, her attack speed is "capped" sort of. She has to *stop and stand still* to get her full DPS if her attack speed goes above what her jumps allow. And considering how people build her, that's gonna be about 90% of the time.
Kalista's W passive needs to go. It gives her so much stupid trading potential. If that's too harsh, maybe move it to her R, so at least you can outtrade her from lvls 1 to 5.
